meanings.definition: A person who believes in or advocates for the preservation and continuation of established institutions.
meanings.sent1: Many institutionalists work to maintain traditional organizations.
meanings.sent2: The institutionalists supported the existing rules and structures.
meanings.sent3: The institutionalists had a party to celebrate the longevity of their favorite museum.
meanings.sent4: She was like an institutionalist, always upholding the values of the old library.
meanings.sent5: The institutionalists were like guardians, protecting the heritage of the community.

meanings.definition: Of or relating to the principles or practices of institutionalists.
meanings.sent1: Her approach had an institutionalist perspective, valuing established systems.
meanings.sent2: The institutionalist policies aimed to maintain the current frameworks.
meanings.sent3: It was an institutionalist decision to keep the traditional decorations.
meanings.sent4: The room had an institutionalist feel, with its classic design.
meanings.sent5: The institutionalist mindset guided their actions towards tradition and stability.
